item.title: Contractors, 24th June
item.description:
2 men cleaning I was cycling to work and using the underpass I cycled past one contractor looking at his phone as I went in the tunnel dust dirt and grime was blown in my face and all over me I had no choice but to get through it quickly No sign and no warning was given It was in my eyes and up my nose and in my mouth even though I tried to hold my breath I’ve had to use eye wash to clean the grit from my eyes and they still hurt now my eyes have also been blurry all day It is still in my hair I had to wash it off my face out of my nose and mouth It is about time it was cleaned but more care for cyclists and pedestrians is needed I would like this acknowledged and something done so it does not happen again I am not a youngster and have been traumatised by this incident
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crittall's Corner, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dipped/broken concrete causing raised kerb and trip hazard, 24th June
item.description:
The concrete has eroded, causing the kerbs to be raised and therefore causing a trip hazard. It is on the entrance to 191 Carlisle Lane. Delivery drivers have issues with wheeling items over this. Items have been damaged when transporting over the defect. I have seen delivery drivers and members of the public tripping on the defect. It's a matter of time before somebody has a bad injury from an accident that this defect has caused. Other 'drive ways'/entrances on the same road are not in such poor condition as this one.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Virgil Street, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Overgrown grass in the crescent, 24th June
item.description:
Would it please be possible for the grass to be cut in the crescent as it is getting very long and myself and family suffer from hayfever and the overgrown grass with its seeds are affecting it to the point where I can’t have my windows open. It has been quite a while since this grass was cut. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Derwent Crescent, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking from Grand Palladium, 24th June
item.description:
When any event is on at Grand Palladium parking is beyond awful people parking on double yellow lines without a blue badge and causing an obstruction and danger
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25-27, Perry Vale, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Albany street, 24th June
item.description:
Elderly Road sign post is fixed the wrong way round, instead of it facing the oncoming traffic to alert them of elderly , it’s facing the side. This is then pointless as drivers can not see it ahead of approaching the area or even when they do. Please train staff on how to fix road signs according to the Highway Code guidelines as this is also the case on Redhill Street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Dipping and RUBBISH, 24th June
item.description:
I know that this problem has been raised, but the following are still outstanding: 1. Fly Tipping (a bed - been there for over two weeks) 2. Thrown rubbish/litter 3. Car Oil stains What would help? More bins (two bins were removed on Well Hall Road) Litter in this street is a regular occurrence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 144, Well Hall Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
